01
Some Questions
some questions
What is Ping An iLaw?

Ping An iLaw is a product upgrade, not the original tool-based legal service platform. Leveraging Ping An's diversified financial scenarios and technological advantages, it integrates precise case law retrieval, personalized professional content recommendations, authoritative and comprehensive legal research knowledge graphs, trial practice experience references, multi-dimensional objective case feature reasoning analysis and similar case intelligent recommendations. It is a professional, integrated, intelligent, open, and efficient legal information service platform.

Ping An iLaw Key Pages
Previous Next
02
Some Goals
Design Goal
Expectations & Voices

"Bring more user thinking and product online thinking to platform construction. Refine product positioning and customer groups, and improve overall product experience."

Business requirements for products

"Time-consuming retrieval on legal platforms?" "High error rate in legal document retrieval experience?"

User feedback on products
Initial Product Status Walkthrough

When we first took over the project, in addition to the initial feedback from business stakeholders and users mentioned above, we also conducted an initial walkthrough of the product. We mainly discovered the following issues: 1) Inconsistent interaction experience; 2) Non-standard component reuse, causing confusion in experience; 3) Users getting lost on the website, sometimes unable to feel in control of progress; 4) No distinction in operation states; 5) Components even overlapping and covering each other; 6) Not conforming to actual workflow; 7) High learning cost; 8) Functions not connected, single scenarios. For these initial problems, we formed some response strategies.

Response Methods

1) Align understanding of problems: Try new methods such as interviews and focus groups to help business stakeholders reach a consistent understanding of existing problems and jointly plan and determine business goals. 2) Become a quick expert: Due to lack of understanding of legal knowledge, I initially found it difficult to get started with the project. With the help of expert judges from the risk control department and colleagues, I gained some understanding of legal processes and legal knowledge, which helped in building the business structure system. Finally, I assisted the product team in successfully completing the product upgrade.
